content:
Ok, so i think I want to keep everything under as few as topics as possible..

I was looking for a POC rust-lang project (https://github.com/gky360/mone) to test the toolchain and rust-lang integration into OpenWrt.

As a reminder: HOST/BUILD x86_64-openwrt-linux-gnu, TARGET mips64-openwrt-linux-musl

I am able to build the project by: CARGO_HOME="/home/grommish/openwrt/staging_dir/host" cargo build in the project directory, but, it builds (and runs) for x86_64. 

~/openwrt$ file build_dir/target-mips64_octeonplus_64_musl/mone-0.1.2/target/debug/mone
build_dir/target-mips64_octeonplus_64_musl/mone-0.1.2/target/debug/mone: ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, BuildID[sha1]=4f899878fb4c3d598141407fd9fa5dac6a99a6ce, for GNU/Linux 3.2.0, with debug_info, not stripped

If I add a --target, I get a whole mess of errors (see attached log)
CARGO_HOME="/home/grommish/openwrt/staging_dir/host" cargo build --target mips64-openwrt-linux-musl

When I do a --print:

$ /home/grommish/openwrt/staging_dir/host/bin/rustc --print target-list | grep openwrt
mips-openwrt-linux-musl
mips64-openwrt-linux-musl

Any suggestions on what I'm missing? I do not know rustc, so it's been a massive en devour to try and find code I can test again.

mone.log
